description: Named after Scottish geologist Sir Archibald Geikie (1835–1924)  +‎ -lite.

entries.meaning: (mineralogy) A trigonal-rhombohedral mineral containing magnesium, oxygen, and titanium.
examples: The free energy remains negative throughout the whole temperature range, indicating that the association forstorite + ilmenite is thermodynamically more stable than foyalite + geikielite.
